newsitem.title: USA: Gateway 2000 recally promo videos amid tampering.
newsitem.headline: Gateway 2000 recally promo videos amid tampering.

text.p: Gateway 2000 Inc., the computer maker, said Monday it is recalling some promotional videotapes because an unknown number apparently include about 30 seconds of sexually explicit content.
The videos were produced between Dec. 20 and Jan. 6, 1997.
Gateway said its general product video is known to have been affected. As a precaution, Gateway is also recalling its Destination promotional video.
Gateway said the offensive material was apparently inserted by a disgruntled employee of a video reproduction supplier, although an investigation continues.
Gateway said it contacted both local and federal authorities about this tampering and is cooperating fully with those agencies in their investigations.

A Gateway spokeswoman said the company, a direct marketer of computers, made the promotional videos available to consumers who called a toll-free number included in its advertising. The promotional videos preview Gateway's products, including its new Destination big-screen personal computer line.
The spokeswoman said the company did not know how many videos were affected by tampering.
She said Gateway was alerted to the problem by "a handful of customers."
The company said individuals who received the videos from Gateway over the holidays were advised to destroy the tapes or return them to Gateway at the company's expense.
It said the objectionable tapes were limited to a single shipment occurring in the week following Christmas. But all tapes produced during that period were being recalled.

"Our main concern right now is protecting our customers," said James Taylor, senior vice president of Gateway 2000. "We stopped mailing tapes as soon as we learned about this and the company is now shipping tapes produced under strict controls."
Taylor said new, replacement tapes are being produced under the strictest security and have been shrink-wrapped with anti-tampering labels.
